Row.Text: Broadcast your intent to settle this land to the world at large. If successful, places a Town under your control.
Spend [icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence to befriend an Independent Power. Becomes a City-State with you as its Suzerain once completed.
Instantly turn this Independent Power into a City-State with you as its Suzerain.
Instantly turn this Independent Power into a City-State with you as its Suzerain.
You are outpacing all other Civilizations
You are being outpaced by another Civilization
{1_initiatorName} is currently improving their relationship with {2_villageName}.
Send a Diplomatic Token to this Village to receive a gift in return.
You reject {1_initialName}'s Alliance offer.[n]No new Alliance between Leaders for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
{1_leaderName} is requesting that you open your borders to them.
Cancels the Diplomatic Action.[n]{1_initialName}'s[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence is refunded.[n]No new Endeavors between Leaders for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
The other playerâ€™s borders will open to you.
{1_initiatorName} has requested that {2_targetName} open their borders for {3_numberTurns} turns.
Another Civilization wants you to open your borders for {1_numberTurns} turns.
Close your borders to another Civilization.
Denounce Military Presence Sanction has started.
Another Leader has denounced you for your military being too close to their Settlement.
A Leader is negotiating to free their captured Commander.
Another Leader has offered you ransom[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold for the return of their captured Commander.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to start a Research Collaboration.
Have a Research Collaboration with another Leader.
From your Research Collaboration with {5_OtherLeaderName}, you are receiving +{2_Amount}[icon:YIELD_SCIENCE] Science per turn.
Cancels the Diplomatic Action.[n]{1_initialName}'s[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence is refunded.[n]No new Endeavors between Leaders for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to start a Cultural Exchange.
Have a Cultural Exchange with another Leader.
From your Cultural Exchange with {5_OtherLeaderName}, you are receiving +{2_Amount}[icon:YIELD_CULTURE] Culture per turn.
Cancels the Diplomatic Action.[n]{1_initialName}'s[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence is refunded.[n]No new Endeavors between Leaders for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
Have Open Markets to do some minor trading with another Leader.
From your Cultural Exchange with {5_OtherLeaderName}, you are receiving +{2_Amount}[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per turn.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to Open Markets to each other.
Cancels the Diplomatic Action.[n]{1_initialName}'s[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence is refunded.[n]No new Endeavors between Leaders for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
Have a Local Festival with another Leader.
From your Local Festival with {5_OtherLeaderName}, you are receiving +{2_Amount}[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness per turn.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to start a Local Festival together.
Blocked from future projects for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
Reveals the other Leader's claimed territory over time.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to Trade Maps.
Both Leaders reveal each others claimed territory over time.
Share agricultural goods with another Leader.
Share agricultural goods with another Leader.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to start a Farmers Market together.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to share Military Aid.

Gives a combat bonus to Military Units.[n]Accepted: Your Units get +2 Combat Strength. Other Leader receives +2[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per turn.[n]Supported: Both Leaders' Units get +3 Combat Strength.
Both Leaders' Units receive +3 Combat Strength.
Hinder the finances of another Leader.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to hinder your finances.
Hinder the finances of another Leader. They lose 10% of their[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per turn.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to hinder your productivity.
Hinder the productivity of another Leader.
Hinder the productivity of another Leader. They lose 10% of their[icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION] Production per turn.
Hinder the morale of another Leader's people.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to hinder your people's morale.
Hinder the morale of another Leader's people. They lose 10% of their[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness per turn.
Hinder the research of another Leader.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to hinder your research.
Hinder the research of another Leader. They lose 10% of their[icon:YIELD_SCIENCE] Science per turn.
Hinder the Civic study of another Leader.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to hinder your Civic study.
Hinder the Civic study of another Leader. They lose 10% of their[icon:YIELD_CULTURE] Culture per turn.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to hinder your military production.
Hinder the military production of another Leader.
Hinder the military production of another Leader. Military Units cost 20% more[icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION] Production to train.
Military Units trained by {4_otherName} cost {3_targetAmount}% more[icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION] Production to train.
Military Units cost you 20% more[icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION] Production to train.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to reduce your Trade Route Limit with all other Civilizations.
Reduce the Trade Route Limit of a Leader with all other Civilizations by 1.
Reduce the Trade Route Limit of a Leader with all other Civilizations. Trade Route Limit is reduced by 1.
Trade Route Limit with all other Civilizations is reduced by 1. Excess Trade Routes are destroyed.
Your Trade Route Limit with all other Civilizations is reduced by 1 for the duration of the Diplomatic Action. Excess Trade Routes are destroyed.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to hinder your agriculture in a Settlement.
Hinder the agriculture in another Leader's Settlement.
Hinder the agriculture in another Leader's Settlement. [icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food is reduced by 20%.
[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food is reduced in the target Settlement.
[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food in the Settlement is reduced by 20%.
Increase your Relationship with the other Leader.
Increase your Relationship with the other Leader.
Your Relationship will increase by 60 over {3_duration} turns.
Your Relationship will increase by 30 over {3_duration} turns.
Decrease your Relationship with the other Leader.
Decrease your Relationship with the other Leader.
Your Relationship will decrease by 60 over {3_duration} turns.
Agree to not attack the other Civilization for the duration of this Diplomatic Action. Doing so will result in War Weariness at the start of the war.
Both Civilizations agree to not attack each other. Doing so will result in War Weariness for the aggressor.
Start a war with the other Civilization.
Accept the other Leader's ransom of {1_gold}[icon:YIELD_GOLD]Gold.
Reject the ransom and block this Leader from negotiating again for 5 turns.
Incite an Independent Power to raid another Civilization.
Incite an Independent Power to raid another Civilization.
The village of {1_ipVillage} is preparing to raid {2_target}.
The village of {1_ipVillage} is preparing to raid {2_target}.
Promote the growth of a City-State by helping it generate[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food.
Promote the growth of a City-State by helping it generate[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food. It generates an additional 15[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food per turn while the Diplomatic Action is active.
Promote the growth of a City-State by helping it generate[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food. It generates an additional 15[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food per turn while the Diplomatic Action is active.
The City State reveals their explored map to you.
Select a Unit from this City-State to permanently take control of.
Select a Unit from this City-State to permanently take control of. The[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence cost of the Unit is equal to its[icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION] Production cost.
Select a Unit from this City-State to permanently take control of.
Incorporate this City-State into your Civilization as a new Town when the Diplomatic Action completes.
Incorporate this City-State into your Civilization as a new Town when the Diplomatic Action completes.
Incorporate this City-State into your Civilization as a new Town when the Diplomatic Action completes.
Create a Military Unit for this City-State.
Create a Military Unit for this City-State.
Creating a new Military Unit for {4_otherName}.
Have a City-State attack another Civilization.
Have a City-State attack another Civilization.
{4_otherName} is preparing to attack another Civilization.
If action accepted, permanently increase the number of Trade Routes you can establish with a Civilization.
{1_leaderName} wants to increase the number of Trade Routes they can establish with you.

Force a Leader with Military Units close to your borders to make a decision to either promise not to attack, or declare a war. If the Leader promises not to attack, they will incur a War Weariness penalty for doing so before the Diplomatic Action ends.
Offer a ransom to another Leader to free a Commander they have captured in battle.
If action accepted, permanently increase the number of Trade Routes you can establish with the other Civilization by 1. [n]Accepted: The target receives [icon:YIELD_GOLD]Gold.
Increase the number of Trade Routes you can establish with {2_otherName} by {3_increaseAmount}. [WIP] Takes effect next turn.

Activate counter Espionage activities to hamper any covert actions you suspect another Leader is taking against you. Doubles the time to complete, increases failure chance by 30%, and increases reveal chance by 30% for espionage actions against you.

Activate counter Espionage activities to hamper any covert actions you suspect another Leader is taking against you. Doubles the time to complete, increases failure chance by 30%, and increases reveal chance by 30% for espionage actions against you.

Activate counter Espionage activities to hamper any covert actions you suspect another Leader is taking against you. Doubles the time to complete, increases failure chance by 30%, and increases reveal chance by 30% for espionage actions against you.

Activate counter Espionage activities to hamper any covert actions you suspect another Leader is taking against you. Doubles the time to complete, increases failure chance by 30%, and increases reveal chance by 30% for espionage actions against you.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to participate in a Reform Endeavor.
Gain a Social Policy slot when the Diplomatic Action completes.

Start the Reform Endeavor.[n]Accepted: You receive a Social Policy slot when the Diplomatic Action completes. Other player receives +4[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per turn until the Diplomatic Action completes.[n]Supported: Both players receive a Social Policy slot when the Diplomatic Action completes.
{1_initialName} gains a Social Policy slot when the Diplomatic Action completes.[n] You gain +12[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per turn for the duration of the Diplomatic Action.
Both players gain a Social Policy slot when the Diplomatic Action completes.
Cancels the Diplomatic Action.[n]{1_initialName}'s[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence is refunded.[n]No new Endeavors between Leaders for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
{1_leaderName} is attempting to trade[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food with you.
Have an agreement to trade[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food with another Leader.
From your Ginseng Agreement with {5_OtherLeaderName}, you are receiving +{2_Amount}[icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food per turn in your Capital.
Cancels the Diplomatic Action.[n]{1_initialName}'s[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence is refunded.[n]No new Endeavors between Leaders for {2_cooldown} turns.[n]Relationships worsen.
Be a Friend of Wei for Science.
{1_leaderName} is inviting you to do[icon:YIELD_SCIENCE] Science research together.

From a Privateer or Pirate attack

The Target's Military Units get -3 to their Combat Strength.
Steal a Technology another Civilization has researched that you have not.
Steal a Civic another Civilization has studied that you have not.
We gained vision of their Commanders.
They gained vision of our Commanders.
{1_leaderName} has denounced your military presence on their borders!
Pay a ransom to a Leader to free a Commander they have captured.
{1_initiatorName} has attempted to pay a ransom to {2_targetName} for the safe return of their captured Commander.
Support of the war has changed.
Another Leader has supported your war.
A Leader has removed support from your war.
Another Leader has opposed your war.
A Leader has removed opposition from your war.
Better War Support causes War Weariness for the other side, which reduces[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness and Combat Strength.
Better War Support causes War Weariness for the other side, which reduces[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness and Combat Strength.
{1_leaderName} is suffering from Moderate War Weariness and has reduced Production and Combat Strength.
{1_leaderName} is suffering from Heavy War Weariness and has greatly reduced Production and Combat Strength.
Support of a Land Claim has changed.
Another Leader has supported your Land Claim.
A Leader has removed support from your Land Claim.
Another Leader has opposed your Land Claim.
A Leader has removed opposition from your Land Claim.
Support of influencing an Independent Power has changed.
Another Leader has supported your influencing an Independent Power.
A Leader has removed support from your influencing an Independent Power.
Another Leader has opposed your influencing an Independent Power.
A Leader has removed opposition from your influencing an Independent Power.
Establishes an Alliance with another Leader.
{1_ipname} is friendly enough they award you with a gift.
{1_ipname} will convert to a City-State soon, with you as its Suzerain. They have bestowed a gift.
Another Leader is about to become the Suzerain of this Independent Power.
The Independent Power is hostile toward you.
The Independent Power is hostile toward you.
The Independent Power is neutral with you and generally shouldn't attack.
The Independent Power is friendly with you.
The Independent Power is friendly enough they award you with a gift.
This Independent Power will convert to a City-State soon, with you as its Suzerain. They have bestowed another gift.
An Independent raid failed. Now they want to be friends.
The Independent Power {1_tribe} has gained a new respect for you after you defeated their raid. They are now friendly with you and your Relationship with them is improving.
Independent Power will be very hostile toward you.
Independent Power will be hostile toward you.
Independent Power will be neutral with you.
Independent Power will be friendly with you.
Independent Power will become a City-State, with you as its Suzerain.
Independent Power will give you a gift.
Plant a flag and gain visibility at the location.
Establish a Town at this location.
Can run an extra instance of a single instance diplomatic action.

Can take at least {1_minTurns} - {2_maxTurns} turns to execute. Once executed, the effect lasts for {3_turns} turns. Execution time, reveal chance, and failure chance are all increased if you are being counterspied by the target.
Can take at least {1_minTurns} - {2_maxTurns} turns to execute. Execution time, reveal chance, and failure chance are all increased if you are being counterspied by the target.
Can take at least {1_minTurns} - {2_maxTurns} turns to execute. {3_actualTurns} have elapsed. Execution time, reveal chance, and failure chance are increased if you are counterspied by the target.
This action has stalled and needs more support.
This action at risk of failing and needs more support.
Likes Leaders that are at war with others, besides him. Dislikes those that are not at war with others, besides him.
Likes Civilizations with fewer Trade Routes than him. Dislikes those that have as many or more Trade Routes than him.
Likes Civilizations with fewer Wonders than her. Dislikes those that have more Wonders than her.
Likes Civilizations with Cities in their empire. Dislikes those with Towns in their empire.
Likes Leaders that complete fewer stories than him. Dislikes those that complete more stories than him.
Likes the Leader doing the most Diplomatic Endeavors. Dislikes the one doing the most Sanctions.

Likes Civilizations with both[icon:YIELD_SCIENCE] Science and[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold Buildings in their Settlements. Dislikes those with both[icon:YIELD_CULTURE] Culture and[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness Buildings in their Settlements.

Likes Civilizations with both[icon:YIELD_CULTURE] Culture and[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness Buildings in their Settlements. Dislikes those with both[icon:YIELD_SCIENCE] Science and[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold Buildings in their Settlements.
Likes the Civilization with the fewest Commander Levels. Dislikes the one with the most Commander Levels.
Likes the Civilization that has had the most Celebrations. Dislikes the one that has had the fewest Celebrations.
Likes Civilizations that don't have any Natural Wonders in their borders. Dislikes those that do have Natural Wonders in their borders.
Likes the Civilization with the greatest number of Military Units. Dislikes the one with the smallest number of Military Units.
Likes the Civilization with the smallest number of Land Units. Dislikes the one with the greatest number of Naval Units.
Likes the Civilization with the highest [icon:YIELD_CULTURE] Culture Per Turn. Dislikes when other Civilizations form Alliances with each other.
Likes Civilizations who have few Mountains in their borders. Dislikes the player with the most Mountains in their borders.
Likes Leaders at war with anyone but him.
Likes the Civilization with the highest[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness. Dislikes the one with the lowest[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness.
Likes the Civilization with least amount of land. Dislikes the one with the largest amount of land.
Likes the Civilization with the most revealed tiles. Dislikes the one with the least revealed tiles.
Likes the Civilization with the least Great Works. Dislikes the one with the most Great Works.
Double Relationship gains with Leaders that share a Government type with him. Double the Relationship losses with those that don't share a Government type.
Likes leaders that start Formal Wars. Dislikes those that start Surprise Wars.
Likes the Civilization with the most Quarters. Dislikes the one with the fewest Quarters.
Likes the Civilization with the most Specialists. Dislikes the one with the fewest Specialists.
Likes Civilizations that don't have Settlements in Desert or Plains. Dislikes those with Settlements in Desert or Plains.
Likes Leaders that leave Independent Powers alone. Dislikes those that disperse Independent Powers.
Likes Leaders with Wonders in their Capital. Dislike those with Buildings in their Capital.

Can't declare war too soon after making peace. {1_turns} {1_turns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;} until war is available.

You cannot support actions against an Ally .
You cannot oppose actions started by an Ally .
You need to be at war to start this Diplomatic Action.

The other player needs at least one town to start this action.
You need at least one settlement to start this action.
The other player needs at least one settlement to start this action.

You cannot start this Diplomatic Action due to being in an Alliance.
You cannot start this Diplomatic Action due to being at war.

You cannot start this Diplomatic Action due to you being at war with their ally {1_AllyName}.
You cannot start this Diplomatic Action since no two or more Units are close enough.
You cannot start this Diplomatic Action since you have opened your borders to them.

You have given the maximum amount of support to this action.

Unable to oppose your own actions.

Projects primarily benefit you, but other Leaders can contribute for lesser rewards.
Projects benefit you and another target Leader, but other Leaders can contribute for lesser rewards.
Sanctions impede other Leaders' progress by reducing certain yields or applying other negative effects.
Are you sure you want to declare war against {1_targetName}?
This action will start a war with {1_targetName}. Are you sure?

This will declare a Formal War since you have a Hostile Relationship.[N]Initial War Support - For you: {1_yourWarBonus}, For them: {2_theirWarBonus}.[N]The penalty for a Surprise War increases with friendlier relations.

This will declare a Surprise War since you do not have a Hostile Relationship. They will gain {3_theirInfluenceBonus}[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence.[N]Initial War Support - For you: {1_yourWarBonus}, For them: {2_theirWarBonus}.[N]The penalty for a Surprise War increases with friendlier relations.

This War will create the following War Support[N] {1_yourWarBonus} for you, {2_theirWarBonus} and {3_theirInfluenceBonus}[icon:YIELD_DIPLOMACY] Influence for your opponent.[N]The penalty for a Surprise War increases with friendlier relations.[N]Being Hostile will create a Formal War.

-3 Combat Strength to your Military Units for {1_turns} {1_turns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
